sen.j: 網野銚子山古墳（あみのちょうしやまこふん）は、京都府京丹後市網野町（旧・竹野郡網野町）にある前方後円墳である。
sen.e: Aminochoshiyama-kofun Tumulus is a keyhole-shaped mound in Amino-cho, Tango City, Kyoto Prefecture (former Amino-cho in Takeno-gun).
Aminochoshiyama-kofun Tumulus is a keyhole-shaped mound in Amino-cho, Tango City, Kyoto Prefecture (former Amino-cho in Takeno-gun).
Amino Choshiyama-kofun Tumulus is a keyhole-shaped mound in Amino-cho, Kyotango City(former Amino-cho, Takeno-gun), Kyoto Prefecture.
It is a gigantic tumulus with the total length of 200 m.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is a gigantic tumulus with the total length of 200 m.
It is a gigantic tumulus with the total length of 200 m.

sen.j: 神明山古墳・蛭子山古墳とともに日本海沿岸三大古墳といわれている。
sen.e: It is counted among the three great tumuli along the coastline of the Sea of Japan, together with the Shinmeiyama-kofun Tumulus and the Ebisuyama-kofun Tumulus.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is counted among the three great tumuli along the coastline of the Sea of Japan, together with the Shinmeiyama-kofun Tumulus and the Ebisuyama-kofun Tumulus.
It is counted among the three great tumuli along the coastline of the Sea of Japan, together with the Shinmeiyama-kofun Tumulus and the Ebisuyama-kofun Tumulus.

sen.j: その中でも最大である。
sen.e: It is the largest of the three.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is the largest of the three.
It is the largest of them.

sen.j: 国史跡に指定されている。
sen.e: It is designated as a national historical site.
It is designated as a national historical site.
It is designated as a national historical site.

sen.j: 日本海を見下ろす丘の上に築かれている。
sen.e: The tumulus is built on the hill overlooking the Sea of Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The tumulus is built on a hill overlooking the Sea of Japan.
The tumulus is built on a hill overlooking the Sea of Japan.

sen.j: 造られた当時はすぐ間近まで潟湖が迫っていたとみられている。
sen.e: At the time of its construction it seems to have been very close to the lagoon.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: At the time of its construction it seems to have been very close to a lagoon.
At the time of its construction it seems to have been very close to a lagoon.

sen.j: 墳丘は前方部を北東に向けた3段構築の前方後円墳。
sen.e: The burial mound is a three-storey keyhole-shaped mound with the frontal part facing the north-east.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The burial mound is a three-story keyhole-shaped mound with the frontal part facing the north-east.
The burial mound is a three-storey keyhole-shaped mound with the frontal part facing the north-east.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.e: The total length is 198 m.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The total length is 198 m.
The total length is 198 m.
The diameter of the back circular part is 115 m and the height is 16 m.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The diameter of the back circular part is 115 m and the height is 16 m.
The diameter of the back circular part is 115 m and the height is 16 m.
The frontal part is 80 m wide and 10 m high.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The frontal part is 80 m wide and 10 m high.
The frontal part is 80 m wide and 10 m high.

sen.j: 葺石がふかれ円筒埴輪の列が巡る。
sen.e: It is covered with stones (fuki-ishi) and encircled by a row of cylindrical haniwa clay figurines.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is covered with stones (fuki-ishi) and encircled by a row of cylindrical haniwa clay figurines.
It is covered with a fuki-ishi (a stone covering an old tomb) and encircled by a row of cylindrical haniwa clay figurines.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 埋葬施設については不明である。
sen.e: Details of the burial facilities are unknown.
Details of the burial facilities are unknown.
Details of the burial facilities are unknown.

sen.j: 築造時期は古墳時代前期末から中期初頭（4世紀末〜5世紀初）とみられている。
sen.e: The tumulus seems to have been built between the end of the early Kofun (Tumulus) period and the beginning of the mid-Kofun period (between the late 4th century and the early 5th century).
The tumulus seems to have been built between the end of the early Kofun (Tumulus) period and the beginning of the mid-Kofun period (between the late 4th century and the early 5th century).
The tumulus seems to have been built between the end of the early Kofun (Tumulus) period and the beginning of the mid-Kofun period (between the late fourth century and the early fifth century).
sen.cmt: スペルアウトしました。

sen.j: 陪塚として寛平法皇陵古墳・小銚子古墳の二つの古墳があり、ともに国の史跡に指定されている。
sen.e: The tumulus is accompanied by two baizuka (smaller tumuli) of the Tumulus of Cloistered Emperor Kanpyo and the Kochoshi-kofun Tumulus, both of which are specified as national historical sites.
The tumulus is accompanied by two baizuka (smaller tumuli) of the Tumulus of Cloistered Emperor Kanpyo and the Kochoshi-kofun Tumulus, both of which are specified as national historical sites.
The tumulus is accompanied by two baizuka (smaller tumuli) of the Tumulus of Cloistered Emperor Kanpyo and the Kochoshi-kofun Tumulus, both of which are specified as national historical sites.

sen.j: 1918年、梅原末治によって調査され、その成果を受けて国史跡に指定される。
sen.e: In 1918 Sueji UMEHARA carried out research on the tumulus, which was designated as a national historical site based on his findings.
In 1918 Sueji UMEHARA carried out research on the tumulus, which was designated as a national historical site based on his findings.
In 1918 Sueji UMEHARA carried out research on the tumulus, which was designated as a national historical site based on his findings.

sen.j: 1986年、ほ場整備による発掘調査で墳丘南東部分に周濠が確認される。
sen.e: Conducted for the purpose of rice paddy development in 1986, the excavation discovered a surrounding moat in the south-eastern part of the mound.
Conducted for the purpose of rice paddy development in 1986, the excavation discovered a surrounding moat in the south-eastern part of the mound.
Conducted for the purpose of rice paddy development in 1986, the excavation discovered a surrounding moat in the south-eastern part of the mound.
